title: Definitions
context: [ยง211D-1] Definitions. As used in this chapter, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Capital access loan&rdquo; means a loan that is entitled to be secured by the fund. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of business, economic development, and tourism. &ldquo;Financial institution&rdquo; includes a bank, trust company, banking association, savings and loan association, mortgage company, investment bank, credit union, or nontraditional financial institution. &ldquo;Fund&rdquo; means the Hawaii capital loan revolving fund established in section 210-3. &ldquo;Loan&rdquo; includes a line of credit. &ldquo;Medium-sized business&rdquo; means a corporation, partnership, sole proprietorship, or other legal entity that: (1) Is domiciled in this State; (2) Is formed to make a profit; and (3) Employs one hundred or more but fewer than five hundred full-time employees. &ldquo;Nonprofit organization&rdquo; means a private, nonprofit, tax-exempt corporation, association, or organization listed in section 501&copy;(3), Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, that is domiciled in this State. &ldquo;Participating financial institution&rdquo; means a financial institution participating in the program. &ldquo;Program&rdquo; means the capital access program. &ldquo;Reserve account&rdquo; means an account established in a participating financial institution on approval of the department in which money is deposited to serve as a source of additional revenue to reimburse the financial institution for losses on loans enrolled in the program. &ldquo;Small business&rdquo; means a corporation, partnership, sole proprietorship, or other legal entity that: (1) Is domiciled in this State; (2) Is formed to make a profit; (3) Is independently owned and operated; and (4) Employs fewer than one hundred full-time employees. [L 2000, c 290, pt of ยง2]
